intro: Trigonella subracemosa, commonly known as the slender fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to fenugreek. The botanical features of Trigonella subracemosa make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
